author: DPA
title: Gastwirt stirbt im Kugelhagel - Gericht verkündet Urteil
text:
1999 wird ein Gastwirt in Würzburg erschossen. Mehr als 26 Jahre später steht das Urteil an. So viele Jahre nach der Tat ist nur ein Delikt noch nicht verjährt.
Mehr als 26 Jahre nach dem gewaltsamen Tod eines Gastwirts in Unterfranken will das Landgericht Würzburg am Donnerstag (13.00 Uhr) ein Urteil in dem Fall verkünden. Angeklagt sind ein 67 Jahre alter Mann und sein 50-jähriger Sohn. Beide äußerten sich in dem seit Januar laufenden Verfahren nicht persönlich zu den Vorwürfen. Für die Verteidiger ist die Täterschaft der Angeklagten nicht erwiesen.
Laut Anklage soll der 50-Jährige am 5. Januar 1999 als damals 23-Jähriger den Gastwirt im Auftrag seines Vaters erschossen haben, um einer Geldforderung Nachdruck zu verleihen. Der 55 Jahre alte Türke wurde durch mehrere Schüsse in seiner Gaststätte in Würzburg getötet. Die Tatwaffe ist bislang nicht gefunden. Im Frühjahr 2024 gingen nach Justizangaben Hinweise zu dem Fall ein, die den Anstoß zu dem Verfahren so lange nach der Tat gaben.
Staatsanwaltschaft und Nebenkläger verlangten in ihren Plädoyers lebenslange Freiheitsstrafen für die Angeklagten wegen Mordes. Zudem wurde beantragt, die Schwere der Schuld festzustellen. Damit wäre eine Entlassung der Verurteilten nach 15 Jahren Haft nahezu ausgeschlossen.
Alles außer Mord ist verjährt
Ist aus Sicht der Kammer den Männern das Tötungsdelikt nicht nachweisbar oder haben sie sich nach dem festgestellten Sachverhalt nicht strafbar gemacht, erfolgt ein Freispruch.
Wenn die Kammer davon ausgeht, dass die Angeklagten das Tötungsdelikt begangen haben, es aber kein Mord war, so kann ebenfalls ein Freispruch ergehen. Geht die Kammer von einem anderen Delikt wie beispielsweise Totschlag aus, könnte eine Einstellung des Verfahrens wegen Verjährung geboten sein.
Reichen aus Sicht des Gerichts allerdings die Beweise, die beiden einen Mord beispielsweise aus Heimtücke oder niedrigen Beweggründen nachweisen, wird es ein Urteil mit Strafzumessung geben.
© dpa-infocom, dpa:250717-930-806832/1

author: Sylvia Quarles
title: Year-End Review: Union Workers Slam Thombert, Inc. Led a successful strike. - Business News
text: December 30 – Thombert, Inc. Employees and members of United Auto Workers Local 997 reached an agreement with top officials on October 21 after nearly three months of protesting. According to the union's Facebook page, which has been posting frequent updates since August, the new contract has been signed. Representatives for UAW Local 997 did not immediately return phone calls from The Newton News by press time, so the contents of the contract remain unknown. When the strike first began, workers were frustrated, Thombert, Inc. had raised “leaps and bounds”, but it was not reflected in his pay cheque. Others argued that management's initial offer was an “insult” and “ridiculous”. Later that month, union groups from across the state joined Thombert workers on strike outside the company's Newton factory. Charlie Wishman, president of the AFL-CIO, the Iowa Federation of Labor, advocated for fair contracts. “We are here to show support and solidarity to let them know they are not alone,” he said. “Right now you have people from all walks of life, business, private sector, public sector. They're all here and in support of this because they want to make sure these people know we have their backs.” Iowa State Auditor Rob Sands showed his support for the union's efforts by meeting with individuals on the picket line earlier this month, as did state senators Nate Bolton and Sarah Garriott in September. US Senator Bernie Sanders also warned the local union on October 19, saying: “I stand in solidarity with the workers of UAW Local 997 in Newton, Iowa who have been on strike for more than (two) months. They are fighting for fair wages and health care costs and a better work-life balance. I “Call upon your employer, Thombert, Inc., to bargain in good faith.” Thombert is one of the world's largest manufacturers of polyurethane wheels and tires for narrow-aisle lift trucks. The manufacturer has been in business for several decades and operates out of Newton and Brooklyn.

author: GB Times
title: Why canʼt I reactivate my TikTok account?
text:
Why Can’t I Reactivate My TikTok Account?
Are you frustrated because you can’t reactivate your TikTok account? You’re not alone. Many users have faced this issue, and it can be frustrating and disappointing, especially if you have a lot of content and followers on your account. In this article, we’ll explore the reasons why you can’t reactivate your TikTok account and what you can do to resolve the issue.
Why Can’t I Reactivate My TikTok Account?
Before we dive into the reasons, let’s first understand what happens when you try to reactivate your TikTok account. When you try to reactivate your account, TikTok checks if your account is eligible for reactivation. If your account is not eligible, you’ll receive an error message indicating that your account is suspended or disabled. There are several reasons why your account might be suspended or disabled, including:
Multiple account violations : If you’ve violated TikTok’s community guidelines multiple times, your account may be suspended or disabled.
Account hacking : If someone has hacked your account and used it to violate TikTok’s community guidelines, your account may be suspended or disabled.
Infringement of intellectual property rights : If your account has been used to infringe on someone else’s intellectual property rights, such as copyright or trademark infringement, your account may be suspended or disabled.
Suspicious activity : If TikTok’s system detects suspicious activity on your account, such as unusual login attempts or unusual activity on your account, your account may be suspended or disabled.
What Can You Do to Reactivate Your TikTok Account?
If your account is suspended or disabled, you can try to reactivate it by following these steps:
Check your email : Check your email for a notification from TikTok explaining why your account was suspended or disabled. This notification may provide you with information on how to resolve the issue and reactivate your account.
Review TikTok’s community guidelines : Review TikTok’s community guidelines to ensure that you’re not violating any of the guidelines. If you’re not sure what the guidelines are, you can check TikTok’s website or contact TikTok’s support team.
Remove violating content : If you’ve uploaded content that violates TikTok’s community guidelines, you may need to remove the content to reactivate your account.
Wait : If your account is suspended or disabled due to suspicious activity, you may need to wait for a period of time before you can reactivate your account.
How to Reactivate Your TikTok Account
If you’ve checked your email, reviewed TikTok’s community guidelines, removed violating content, and waited the required time, you can try to reactivate your TikTok account by following these steps:
Open TikTok : Open the TikTok app on your device.
Tap on "Me" : Tap on the "Me" icon in the bottom navigation bar.
Tap on "Reactivate Account" : Tap on the "Reactivate Account" button.
Enter your email and password : Enter your email and password to log in to your account.
Follow the prompts : Follow the prompts to reactivate your account.
What to Do If You’re Still Having Trouble Reactivating Your TikTok Account
If you’re still having trouble reactivating your TikTok account, you can try the following:
Contact TikTok’s support team : Contact TikTok’s support team by filling out the support form on TikTok’s website. Provide as much information as possible about your issue, including any error messages you’ve received.
Check your account settings : Check your account settings to ensure that your account is set up correctly. Make sure that your email address and password are correct, and that your account is not set to private.
Try using a different device : Try using a different device to reactivate your account. Sometimes, issues with reactivating an account can be resolved by using a different device.
Conclusion
Reactivating a suspended or disabled TikTok account can be frustrating and disappointing, but it’s not impossible. By understanding the reasons why your account may be suspended or disabled, you can take steps to resolve the issue and reactivate your account. Remember to check your email, review TikTok’s community guidelines, remove violating content, and wait the required time before trying to reactivate your account. If you’re still having trouble, you can contact TikTok’s support team or try using a different device.
Common Reasons for Account Suspension or Disablement
Here are some common reasons why TikTok accounts may be suspended or disabled:
Reason
Description
Multiple account violations
Violating TikTok’s community guidelines multiple times
Account hacking
Hacking into someone else’s account and using it to violate TikTok’s community guidelines
Infringement of intellectual property rights
Using someone else’s intellectual property rights, such as copyright or trademark infringement
Suspicious activity
Engaging in suspicious activity on your account, such as unusual login attempts or unusual activity on your account
Frequently Asked Questions
Here are some frequently asked questions about reactivating a suspended or disabled TikTok account:
Q: Why can’t I reactivate my TikTok account?
A: There are several reasons why you may not be able to reactivate your TikTok account, including multiple account violations, account hacking, infringement of intellectual property rights, and suspicious activity.
Q: What can I do to reactivate my TikTok account?
A: You can try checking your email for a notification from TikTok, reviewing TikTok’s community guidelines, removing violating content, and waiting the required time before trying to reactivate your account.
Q: How do I reactivate my TikTok account?
A: To reactivate your TikTok account, open the TikTok app, tap on the "Me" icon, tap on the "Reactivate Account" button, enter your email and password, and follow the prompts.
Q: What if I’m still having trouble reactivating my TikTok account?
A: If you’re still having trouble reactivating your TikTok account, you can try contacting TikTok’s support team, checking your account settings, and trying using a different device.

author: businesstelegraph
title: Now that's what you call a love bite! Grisly footage reveals how male sharks grasp females with their TEETH during sex
text:
They are some of the ocean’s most fearsome predators.
Now, a study has revealed that sharks can be just as dangerous to their mates as they are to their prey.
Gruesome footage reveals the horrendous injuries inflicted by male sharks as they grasp females with their teeth while they mate.
These bloody love bites are now helping scientists piece together the hidden secrets of sharks’ sex lives.
To mate, sharks have to press their bellies together while the male penetrates the female.
That’s a fairly straightforward process for smaller, more nimble species.
However, larger sharks often struggle to line themselves up for long enough.
This means that male sharks often violently bite down on the fins or gills of their mate to hold them in place, inflicting deep cuts in the process.
While mating, male sharks will bite onto the pectoral fins or gills of females to hold them in place long enough to press their bellies together
The researchers looked at ‘mating wounds’ sustained by sand tiger sharks, a species which can grow up to three metres (10ft) in length.
Because these sharks spend most of their time as solitary hunters who mate out at sea, scientists don’t know many of the intimate details of their sex lives.
Although cases of mating in the wild have only rarely been observed, the researchers realised that they could look at mating wounds instead.
Lead author Dr Jennifer Wyffels, a research scientists at Ripley’s Aquariums and the University of Delaware, told LiveScience : ‘Sharks and rays use their mouths to hold and position females and therefore, mating wounds are common during the reproductive season.
‘Observations of mating for any shark or ray species are very rare so we used mating wounds as indirect evidence for reproductive behavior.’
First, Dr Wyffels and her team observed a group of sand tiger sharks housed at Ripley’s Aquarium of Canada Marine Science Center.
During this time the researchers recorded the sharks mating and saw how the male left severe wounds on the female.
The deepest injuries cut through the female’s skin down to the muscle but were surprisingly quick to heal – closing completely in just 22 days.
These violent rituals leave the females, and sometimes even the males, with deep ‘mating wounds’ which cut through the skin down to the muscle
Researchers examined the mating wounds sustained by sand tiger sharks held in an aquarium as they healed. This allowed them to create a scale for rating the severity and freshness of mating wounds
Sand tiger sharks: Key facts Scientific name : Carcharias taurus
Size : 2-3 metres (6.5-10ft)
Weight : 90-160 kg (200 to 350 lbs)
Habitat : Shallow, temperate regions near the coast in all oceans apart from the Eastern Pacific
Diet : Small fish and crustaceans
Conservations status : Vulnerable
Despite their fierce appearance, sand tiger sharks are actually docile and are only known to attack humans when threatened first. They are the only sharks known to come to the surface to gulp air which they store in their stomachs to float motionless while hunting. They have one of the lowest reproduction rates of any shark.
By recording those injuries and the healing process, the researchers developed a scale for describing the severity and healing stages of mating wounds.
The scale ranges from fresh, open stage one wounds to stage four wounds which have started to scar over.
Dr Wyffels and her co-authors then applied this scale to photos in the Spot A Shark USA database which collects citizens’ shark sighting images.
They analysed 2,876 pictures of 686 individual sand tiger sharks taken between 2015 and 2020.
These images revealed that the number of stage one wounds rose sharply in late May, suggesting that this is the peak of the breeding season.
By July, the number of fresh wounds had levelled off which indicates that the sharks were either mating less frequently or were doing so less violently.
In their paper, published in Environmental Biology of Fishes, the researchers write: ‘By mid to late summer, mating has ceased based on the lack of stages 1 and 2 mating wounds on females.’
The fact that the number of fresh wounds was highest off the coast of North Carolina also suggests that this is a popular breeding ground for sand tiger sharks.
The researchers analysed photos of sand tiger sharks in the Spot A Shark USA database to see how many mating wounds they had. Injuries sustained in the zones labelled 3, 4, and 5 were classified as mating wounds
This revealed that sharks had the most fresh wounds during late May, suggesting that the mating season is in mid to late summer. The data also shows that sharks with mating wounds were concentrated around North Carolina. This shows that the area is a mating and gestation hot-spot for sand tiger sharks
Likewise, the researchers noticed that this region had a high number of female sharks bearing wounds which had been healing for much longer.
They write: ‘The presence of stages 1 and 2 mating wounds on sand tiger sharks in North Carolina suggests the area is used for mating while females with stages 3 and 4 mating wounds provide evidence that the area also serves as gestation habitat for this species.’
In addition to providing new insights into the lives of these elusive creatures, it also confirms their incredible powers of healing.
In the wild, sharks have been observed to live for long periods of time after suffering seemingly deadly wounds.
During the study, the researchers even found sand tiger sharks which were living with their jaw almost torn off and parts of their skull exposed by wounds.
However, they also found that wounds suffered by the aquarium sharks closed after 22 days and finished scarring over 85 days after being injured.
This rapid healing factor might explain how sharks survive for so long after injuries and why their mating wounds very rarely lead to long-term damage.
WHAT GIVES RISE TO SHARKS’ ‘SIXTH SENSE’? Shark have electrosensory organs that act like a ‘sixth sense’
The ampullae of Lorenzini are visible as small pores in the skin around the head and on the underside of sharks, skates, and rays.
Each pore is open and connected to a set of electrosensory cells by a long canal filled with a clear, viscous jelly.
The AoL jelly likely contributes to this electrosensing function, yet the exact details of this contribution remain unclear.
‘Skates and sharks have some of the most sensitive electroreceptors in the animal world,’ said Dr David Julius, professor and chair of physiology at UCSF and senior author of a recent study on the mechanism.
‘Understanding how this works is like understanding how proteins in the eye sense light – it gives us insight into a whole new sensory world,’ he said.
READ SOURCE

author: CNA
title: Raya wonder save earns Arsenal a point at Atalanta - CNA
text:
Advertisement Sport
Raya wonder save earns Arsenal a point at Atalanta
Soccer Football - Champions League - Atalanta v Arsenal - Gewiss Stadium, Bergamo, Italy - September 19, 2024 Arsenal's David Raya saves the rebound from Atalanta's Mateo Retegui after saving a penalty REUTERS/Alessandro Garofalo
Soccer Football - Champions League - Atalanta v Arsenal - Gewiss Stadium, Bergamo, Italy - September 19, 2024 Arsenal's David Raya celebrates with William Saliba after saving a penalty from Atalanta's Mateo Retegui REUTERS/Alessandro Garofalo TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY
Soccer Football - Champions League - Atalanta v Arsenal - Gewiss Stadium, Bergamo, Italy - September 19, 2024 Arsenal's Raheem Sterling in action with Atalanta's Juan Cuadrado REUTERS/Alessandro Garofalo
Soccer Football - Champions League - Atalanta v Arsenal - Gewiss Stadium, Bergamo, Italy - September 19, 2024 Arsenal's Raheem Sterling in action with Atalanta's Sead Kolasinac and Matteo Ruggeri REUTERS/Alessandro Garofalo 20 Sep 2024 05:02AM (Updated: 20 Sep 2024 05:23AM) Bookmark Bookmark Share WhatsApp Telegram Facebook Twitter Email LinkedIn BERGAMO, Italy :Arsenal goalkeeper David Raya secured his side a hard-earned point with a sensational penalty save in a 0-0 draw away to Atalanta in their Champions League opener on Thursday.
Spaniard Raya dived low to his right to beat out Mateo Retegui's spot kick in the 51st minute then sprang across his goal to claw away the forward's follow up header.
It was a gritty display by Mikel Arteta's side who soaked up home pressure inside a raucous Stadio di Bergamo and occasionally looked dangerous at the other end.
The closest Arsenal came to scoring was a first-half free kick by Bukayo Saka that was saved well by Atalanta goalkeeper Marco Carnesecchi while Gabriel Martinelli blasted over the crossbar in a rare Arsenal attack after the break.
Arsenal, without injured skipper Martin Odegaard, were not at their best but made sure they returned to London with a point in the bag thanks to the exploits of Raya.
Atalanta were handed the chance to go ahead when Thomas Partey tangled with Ederson on the edge of the area and the referee Clement Turpin pointed to the spot.
After a lengthy VAR check, Retegui eventually took the kick but after a stuttering run, his low shot was read by Raya who then showed elastic-like agility to make the double-save.
"It was a very difficult game but I think we also made it difficult for them, Raya said.
"A point away from home in the first Champions League game, we could have played a bit better but if you can't win the game then don't lose it."
Of his penalty save, he added: "I was lucky to go the right way and unlucky that the rebound fell to him, but I was quick enough to get up and save it. Fantastic to keep a clean sheet."
It was the first ever clash between the sides with Atalanta having qualified for the competition by finishing fourth in Serie A last season, while they also won the Europa League.
While Atalanta will be frustrated at not beginning with a notable victory, Gian Piero Gasperini's side showed that they will be a tough nut to crack in the group phase.
Source: Reuters Sign up for our newsletters Get our pick of top stories and thought-provoking articles in your inbox

author: Le10Sport.com
title: Le PSG à l’origine d’une future catastrophe à Marseille ? - Le10sport.com
text: Finalement, la finale de la Ligue des Champions ne se déroulera pas à Milan en 2027. En conséquence, la mairie de Marseille a pris position pour accueillera l’événement au Vélodrome. Si tel était le cas, cela pose alors de grandes question si le PSG venait à jouer et gagner dans le stade de l’OM. Cela pourrait virer au désastre… Depuis 2011 et le rachat du [PSG](https://le10sport.com/football/ligue1/psg/psg-nouvelle-tension-avec-un-journaliste-714704), le Qatar n’a qu’un rêve : remporter la Ligue des Champions. Un rêve qui pourrait être exaucé en 2027… à Marseille. En effet, la cité phocéenne est candidate pour accueillir la finale suite au désistement de Milan. Mais compte tenu des rivalités avec l’OM, le fait que le PSG joue cette finale au Vélodrome pourrait virer au fiasco total. Mercato : Le PSG déjà plombé pour deux gros transferts ? — le10sport (@le10sport)[https://t.co/ylpomKixgS][pic.twitter.com/ge6guho0Zh][September 26, 2024] « Une mauvaise idée » « Si tout à fait par hasard il y avait 20 000 ou 25 000 Parisiens qui débarquaient ai Stade Vélodrome, ça serait ingérable. Je ne vois pas comment dans l’état actuel de la France, on peut espérer que ça se passe comme il faut. Aujourd’hui, ne serait-ce qu’avoir l’idée, je pense que c’est problème. Je pense que c’est une mauvaise idée », a ainsi confié Jean-Michel Larqué sur RMC. « La risée de tout le monde » Jean-Michel Larqué s’est par ailleurs rappelé la dernière finale de Ligue des Champions en France, qui était Real Madrid-Liverpool au Stade de France, et qui a été une catastrophe : « Il y a eu une finale de Ligue des Champions à Paris, qui n’impliquait ni le PSG ni l’OM qui a été une catastrophe nationale. Ce n’est pas vieux. On a été incapable de gérer cette finale. On a été la honte de la France et la risée de tout le monde ».

author: @infoitestero
title: Attacco di droni ucraini su base aerea russa di Volgograd
text: [ ](/a/9E5CBAE8-892A-4288-99B2-ED65C4383C0F/Questi-serbatoi-di-carburante-in-Russia-stanno-bruciando-da-cinque-giorni-Video) [Leggi](https://www.rainews.it/video/2024/08/questi-serbatoi-di-carburante-in-russia-stanno-bruciando-da-cinque-giorni-08eaaeb2-4285-4244-bfa9-46fbd8611a93.html) Nella notte, le forze armate ucraine hanno lanciato un attacco con droni contro la base aerea militare russa di Marinovka, situata nella regione di Volgograd. Un video postato anonimamente su Telegram mostra del denso fumo nero alzarsi dalla base aerea, confermando l'entità dell'attacco. L'attacco ha provocato un incendio significativo nella base aerea, con le forze della difesa aerea russa che hanno tentato di respingere l'assalto. L'incendio ha causato danni considerevoli, con serbatoi di carburante in fiamme e una vasta area colpita. Questo attacco si inserisce in un contesto di crescenti tensioni e scontri nella regione occidentale russa di Kursk, dove le forze ucraine continuano a spingersi. A Proletarsk, nella regione di Rostov, un deposito petrolifero Rosrezerv è in fiamme da cinque giorni a causa di un attacco di droni avvenuto il 18 agosto. L'incendio a Proletarsk ha coinvolto 22 serbatoi di carburante e ha causato ferite a 47 vigili del fuoco, di cui 15 in condizioni gravi. Inoltre, 49 lavoratori sono rimasti feriti. Al 20 agosto, l'area dell'incendio copriva diecimila metri quadrati. Nel frattempo, la Russia ha messo sotto inchiesta un reporter della CNN e due giornalisti della TV ucraina, accusandoli di coinvolgimento negli attacchi. Kiev ha smentito le accuse di Putin riguardo a presunti attacchi alla centrale nucleare di Kursk, alimentando ulteriormente le tensioni tra i due paesi.

author: @WOWT6News
title: Junkyard employee saves cat from car crusher after finding her under hood
text: Junkyard employee saves cat from car crusher after finding her under hood ASHEVILLE, N.C. ( [WHNS](https://www.foxcarolina.com/2024/02/29/junkyard-employee-saves-cat-car-crusher-after-finding-her-under-hood/)/Gray News) – A junkyard employee in North Carolina saved a cat from a car about to be crushed. According to Brother Wolf Animal Rescue, an employee at the junkyard was removing the car’s battery “just moments” before it was sent to be crushed. “As he popped open the hood, a bundle of fur jumped out and took a blind leap of faith into his arms,” Brother Wolf Animal Rescue wrote in [a Facebook post](https://www.facebook.com/BrotherWolfAnimalRescue/posts/pfbid02UTAG5neApB6ibhsRFA9UcR1VYHV6aGi3qWvSMNNoFXuZzzi8KYCdcPF1sBRkxsBSl). “She looked at him with soft eyes, thanking him with slow blinks and soft purrs. It was almost like she knew that her life had been saved.” The employee kept the cat bundled in his jacket for the rest of his shift before turning it over to Brother Wolf Animal Rescue, where his girlfriend works. A man called the junkyard very soon after, searching frantically for his cat. He described his cat, Lilly, as very adventurous, who loves riding in the car or on his motorcycle with him. She even has her own helmet. Brother Wolf Animal Rescue confirmed Lilly was the cat that the junkyard employee had rescued. The shelter offered to return Lilly to her owner vaccinated, microchipped, and spayed at no cost. He gladly accepted the offer. Lilly and her owner were reunited and very happy to see each other. “She melted into his arms as his eyes filled with tears of joy,” the shelter wrote in a Facebook post. Copyright 2024 WHNS via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.
